sentences.en: An audible gasp went round the court as the jury announced the verdict.
sentences.cn: 陪审团宣布判决的时候，听到法庭上有人倒抽了一口气。

sentences.en: Her voice was barely audible above the noise.
sentences.cn: 一片嘈杂，她的声音只能勉强听得见。

sentences.en: His voice was barely audible (=  could only just be heard  ) above the roar of the crowd.
sentences.cn: 人声嘈杂，几乎听不见他的说话声。

sentences.en: His voice was unsteady and only just audible.
sentences.cn: 他的声音发颤，而且小得只刚刚能听见。

sentences.en: It was Colin's voice, only just audible.
sentences.cn: 那是科林的声音，勉强能听得见。

sentences.en: Little audible links, they are, chaining together great inaudible feelings and purposes.
sentences.cn: 它们只是一些可以为人听见的小小链子, 把大量听不见的情感和意图串联起来.

sentences.en: She'd lowered her voice until it was barely audible.
sentences.cn: 她把嗓音压低到几乎听不见。

sentences.en: The Co-lonel's voice was barely audible.
sentences.cn: 上校微弱的声音几不可闻。

sentences.en: The noise was audible even above the roar of the engines.
sentences.cn: 尽管有发动机的轰鸣声,这个噪音还是能够听到.

sentences.en: The singer's voice was just audible.
sentences.cn: 那名歌手的声音刚刚能听见.

sentences.en: There followed a barely audible burp.
sentences.cn: 接着是几乎听不见的打嗝声。

sentences.en: There was an audible sigh of relief in Washington when the foreign ministers decided to postpone the meeting.
sentences.cn: 各国外长决定推迟会议后，华盛顿如释重负。

sentences.en: There was an audible sigh of relief.
There was an audible stillness, in which the common voice sounded strange.
sentences.cn: 车间变得异样的寂静,简直可以用耳朵听到这寂静, 而人的声音听上去反而怪怪的.

trans.tran_en: a sound that is audible is loud enough for you to hear it
